comments.body: Or maybe even just having different/primitive weapons made from such materials. For example a stone club with bones for a handle, a bamboo spear made with flint that functions similarly to a trident, etc. These weapons wouldn't do as much damage as most and would be far less superior in terms of durability, but it would allow for diverse, disposable weapons if ever caught in a pinch.
I love the idea, but instead of using an anvil this could work well with the new smithing table crafting system

It seems to me that a blaze rod handle is a bad idea, and bamboo is already involved in the crafting of a stick. A handle made of bones, horns - quite historical and applicable. I believe that winding the handle on the smithing table with thread, leather, wire (this was also done) will increase recovery after hitting / breaking the block.

These are made purely for cosmetics to expand storytelling, like trims. So if a player wants to boast their time in the nether and have a flame handle looking sword, they can. This isn't supposed to directly tie to crafting but more so what can be substituted as a handle and show where someone's been
官方肯定不一定会采纳
Cómo actualizar Minecraft
La verdad tengo una duda soy nuevo en Minecraft y necesito saber cómo se actualiza

I would suggest it'd be more interesting to have something like the cauldron's behavior for pots, but they're only able to store liquids and dust items. 

I'd say one bucket of water or lava (perhaps lava breaks the pot slowly over time and spills out?), or a couple stacks of a dust item like sugar, redstone, blaze powder, and gunpowder, and maybe even blocks like sand, concrete powder and gravel.

There could also be some special behaviour depending on the items stored: for pots which have gunpowder stored, they could explode with a radius and power proportional to the amount of gunpowder inside. For pots that have a bucket of water, adding sand could perhaps make balls of clay which can only be accessed by breaking the pot.

It's a good idea, but it would be better if only the Decorated pot could store 1 item without inventory and without slots, just by right clicking + shift. and that when breaking it the item comes out, and in case it is the spawn egg of any mob, that when breaking the Decorated pot the egg makes the mob spawn, something like the game of "break vases and see what surprises they have inside, that can be good or dangerous at the same time"
We need cherries!!!!

I agree, Bananas from Jungle trees, Pears from Dark Oak trees, Cherries from Cherry trees. Add Onions, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Rice. Also make Noodles! Noodles would complement the Cherry trees pretty well. Make Salads! And add drink cups!

I think we should have corn (Maize) so you could not only have cornbread and popcorn, but you could make a corn maze in Minecraft. It could grow 2 blocks tall so you can't see your surroundings when you're in the corn, but you can hear zombies and monsters.

There's not really any point of new food items in minecraft at the moment because they would have the exact same function as existing food. Minecraft needs to revamp their food system so that different food items have different uses.
Or add some ancient cities and monuments like Bombay or the China wall or even the castles of Europe and maybe also add dinosaur bones It's a big update.
It would be wonderful if the cherries can be used for potions ! Maybe for haste or a new one...
Otters are carnivorous and should be fed crayfish, perch or frogs instead
it will be cool to see them eat (and hold) fish. maybe they can float?

Otters are AMAZING! They can fill up rivers, get rid of those overpopulated salmon, and give a reason for players to actually visit rivers for fun rather than going all the way to the ocean just for some dolphin. This could also add electric eels, which could tell the player to back off when getting too rowdy with some animals! Perfect idea.
In nature otters also eat frogs
they could also attack you if you attack them
I'd love if you could feed otters and in return they help fight off drowned! They could also wear turtle helmets to protect them and because it's cute!
Perhaps a temporary recording of the last five minutes is made for chat reporting purposes.
The "Chat range" mechanic should be implemented. The same goes for text chat.
I WOULD LOVE IT FOR BEDROCK.
This should be a in game feature as other games
We need this for bedrock it would make it a lot of fun
yea
I personally think Meerkats should not be a desert exclusive, but also be found in the Plains and Savannah, but I could be mistaking them for Prairie Dogs
The desert can't be updated until savannah is. Biomes from biome votes need to be added in the order they came in the biome vote, and that year the results were: 1. Taiga 2. Savannah 3. Desert.

Would be cool to see multiple colored ones too!

They rejected this, it would be imbalanced for game design. Intentionally only cosmetic.

Amor trims are cosmetics, the game would be a lot more easier
armor trim patterns should be like sinking in the armor so that it looks kinnda s
Armor trims should like sink in the armor when it is applied so that it looks 3D
yes. Either that, or mangrove wood. Regular swamps need their own tree type! It's very disappointing that they weren't touched at all in 1.19, aside from frogs now spawning there.

Yes! And make it a pale off-white, but cool toned rather than warm toned (like Birch). And the leaves would be a sage green, not a bold green like what we have already. I'm still hoping that we eventually get Willow trees so that Swamps get new trees, other than just Mangroves.
Bone meal can up the growth, and the wither bone meal can stop it, is incredible
Wither bones could be used for taming netherhounds or skelehounds

The wither bonemeal mechanic would be great for builders in survival mode

This could be paired with THIS post about Fruit trees.

Bone Meal will increase growth.
Wither Bone Meal could cause fruits to rot.
       Could be good for pranks, or just being a Jerk.

The reason wither skeletons are black is because their bones are covered in coal, as evidenced by their drops. This suggests, that, if this were to be added, wither bone meal could... set crops on fire?

Well, that certainly would stop their growth.

Love the idea! I think it could be implemented using some of the ingredients to make a invisibility potion (Fermented spider eye, golden carrot) so it could help out with players learning to brew!

we already do
/give @s item_frame{EntityTag:{Invisible:1}}

For convenience sake, they would only turn invisible if there's an item inside, so people won't accidently forget where they placed them (and to prevent trolling, because item frames cause lag so putting a bunch of invisible entities everywhere would be annoying).

^And to one of the above comments, I'm pretty sure they meant an invisible item frame we can actually get in survival mode.
Yeah, we already have them, but we want them in survival
this IS a thing in origin realms a server made by systemzee and his crew adding things that aren't in minecraft or not yet.

reply to some who point out the mess of unknown invis frames making a mess, why don't make it so that these invis frames will hide itself only when the item is placed into it, so you don't have to worry about these invisible thingies since they show themselves when nothing is placed in it
